meanings.definition: The measurement of the intensity of light.
meanings.sent1: Photometry helps scientists understand how bright a light is.
meanings.sent2: In the lab, photometry is used to determine the luminosity of different sources.
meanings.sent3: During the photometry experiment, the light bulb started telling jokes!
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a photometry reading on a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The photometry results were as clear as day, revealing the true brightness of the stars.

meanings.sent1: Using photometry, researchers can accurately quantify the amount of light emitted.

meanings.sent3: The photometry workshop was enlightening, shedding light on new ways to measure brightness.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with the precision of a photometry instrument.
meanings.sent5: The art exhibit was a masterpiece of photometry, showcasing the play of light and shadow.
